name: Bank
specification: The Bank contract stores assets deposited by users, and and pays them out when required. The `deposit` method allows anyone to deposit assets. When a deposit is made, the corresponding amount is added to the account balance of the sender. The `withdraw` method allows the sender to receive any desired amount of assets deposited in their account. The contract checks that the depositor has sufficient funds in their account and then transfers the specified amount to the sender. In this version of the contract, the only asset handled by the contract is the ETH crypto-currency.

properties.deposit-contract-balance: after a successful `deposit()`, the ETH balance of the contract is increased by `msg.value`.
properties.deposit-not-revert: a `deposit` call does not revert if  `msg.value` is less or equal to the ETH balance of `msg.sender`.
properties.deposit-revert-if-low-eth: a `deposit` call reverts if `msg.value` is greater than the ETH balance of `msg.sender`.
properties.deposit-user-balance: after a successful `deposit()`, the balance entry of `msg.sender` is increased by `msg.value`.
properties.user-balance-inc-onlyif-deposit: the only way to increase the balance entry of a user `a` is by calling `deposit` with `msg.sender = a`.
properties.user-balance-dec-onlyif-withdraw: the only way to decrease the balance entry of a user `a` is by calling `withdraw` with `msg.sender = a`.
properties.withdraw-contract-balance: after a successful `withdraw(amount)`, the ETH balance the contract is decreased by `amount`.
properties.withdraw-not-revert: a `withdraw(amount)` call does not revert if  `amount` is bigger than zero and less or equal to the balance entry of `msg.sender`.
properties.withdraw-revert: a `withdraw(amount)` call reverts if `amount` is zero or greater than the balance entry of `msg.sender`.
properties.withdraw-sender-rcv: after a successful `withdraw(amount)`, the ETH balance of the transaction sender is increased by `amount` ETH.
properties.withdraw-sender-rcv-EOA: after a successful `withdraw(amount)` originated by an EOA, the ETH balance of the transaction sender is increased by `amount` ETH.
properties.withdraw-user-balance: after a successful `withdraw(amount)`, the balance entry of `msg.sender` is decreased by `amount`.
properties.deposit-assets-transfer-others: after a successful `deposit(amount)`, the assets controlled by any user but the sender are preserved.
properties.deposit-assets-balance-others: after a successful `deposit(amount)`, the balance entry of any user but the sender is preserved.
properties.deposit-additivity: two (successful) `deposit` of n1 and n2 units of T (performed by the same sender) are equivalent to a single `deposit` of n1+n2 units of T.
properties.assets-dec-onlyif-deposit: if the assets of a user A are decreased after a transaction (of the Bank contract), then that transaction must be a `deposit` where A is the sender.
properties.assets-inc-onlyif-withdraw: if the assets of a user A are increased after a transaction (of the Bank contract), then that transaction must be a `withdraw` where A is the sender.
properties.withdraw-assets-transfer-others: after a successful `withdraw(amount)`, the assets controlled by any user but the sender are preserved.
properties.withdraw-assets-balance-others: after a successful `withdraw(amount)`, the balance entry of any user but the sender is preserved.
properties.withdraw-additivity: two (successful) `withdraw` of n1 and n2 units of T (performed by the same sender) are equivalent to a single `withdraw` of n1+n2 units of T.
properties.userbalances-leq-balance: the assets controlled by the contract are (at least) equal to the sum of all the user balances
properties.no-frozen-credits: if the sum of all the balances is strictly positive, it is possible to reduce them
properties.no-frozen-assets: if the contract controls some assets, then someone can transfer them from the contract to some user
properties.exists-at-least-one-balance-change: after a successful transaction, the credits of at least one account have changed
properties.exists-unique-asset-change: after a successful transaction, the assets of exactly one account (except the contractâ€™s) have changed
properties.exists-unique-balance-change: after a successful transaction, the balances of exactly one account have changed
